com.ibm.team.process.client
Interface IProcessItemService

All Superinterfaces:
IProcessClientService
public interface IProcessItemService
extends IProcessClientService

Process client library which provides facilities for manipulating process-related items.

Since:
0.5

Method Detail

getTeamRepository

ITeamRepository getTeamRepository()
Returns the team repository this client library is associated with.

Returns:
the team repository this client library is associated with

createProjectArea

IProjectArea createProjectArea()
Creates a new project area instance. This instance is a mutable copy. This project area exists only in memory; it is not yet persisted in the repository.

The returned project area is not managed by the item manager. Items returned by this method will have their origin set to the repository associated with this client library.

Returns:
a new project area instance

createTeamArea

ITeamArea createTeamArea()
Creates a new team area instance. This instance is a mutable copy. This team area exists only in memory; it is not yet persisted in the repository.

The returned team area is not managed by the item manager. Items returned by this method will have their origin set to the repository associated with this client library.

Returns:
a new team area instance

The returned process definition is not managed by the item manager. Items returned by this method will have their origin set to the repository associated with this client library.

Returns:
a new process definition instance

getMutableCopy

IProcessItem getMutableCopy(IProcessItem processItem)
                            throws TeamRepositoryException
Returns a mutable copy of the given process item. If the item manager is aware of a newer state of the given process item, the returned mutable copy is based on that newer state and thus can differ from the given process item.

Parameters:
processItem - the process item
Returns:
a mutable copy of the given process item
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException - in case this operation fails

getCurrentIterations

IIteration[] getCurrentIterations(IDevelopmentLineHandle lineHandle,
                                  org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                  throws TeamRepositoryException
Returns the path of iterations to the given development line's current iteration. The returned collection of iterations is ordered from the iteration to the current. If the collection is not empty, the 0-th element will be an iteration whose parent is the development line and the last element will be the current iteration.

The returned iterations are managed by the item manager.

Parameters:
lineHandle - the development line
monitor - a progress monitor or null
Returns:
the path of iterations to the given development line's current iteration
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException - in case this operation fails
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - in case this operation has been canceled
Since:
0.6

Parameters:

attachmentPath - the path
monitor - the progress monitor or null
Returns:
the attachment at the given path in the given container or null
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException - in case this operation fails

Since:
0.6

save

IProcessItem save(IProcessItem processItem,
                  org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                  throws TeamRepositoryException
Saves the given process item in the repository. The process item passed in must be mutable. Saving a process item creates a new state in the process item's history and advances the current state of this item.

The returned item is immutable and managed by the item manager. The passed in item will be immutable after this method completed.

Parameters:
processItem - the process item to be saved
monitor - the progress monitor or null
Returns:
the saved process item
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException - in case this operation fails
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - in case this operation has been canceled

save

IProcessItem[] save(IProcessItem[] processItems,
                    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                    throws TeamRepositoryException
Saves the given process items in the repository. The process items passed in must be mutable. Saving the process item creates for each of them a new state in the process item's history and advances the current state of these items.

The returned items are immutable and managed by the item manager. The returned array of items use the same positional information as the passed in array of items. The passed in items will be immutable after this method completed.

This method exhibits transactional behavior. Either all items are saved successfully or none of them is saved in the repository.

Parameters:
processItems - the array of process items to be saved
monitor - the progress monitor or null
Returns:
the saved process item
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException - in case this operation fails
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - in case this operation has been canceled

delete

void delete(IProcessItemHandle processItemHandle,
            boolean recursively,
            org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
            throws TeamRepositoryException
Deletes the given process item persistently from the repository. The item manager is informed about the deletion and updates of any item that happens in the course of this operation.

recursively indicates whether the delete operation should also delete all child elements. The only process elements that can have children are process areas. If the process area to be deleted is a project area, the recursive delete operation deletes all of the project area's team areas. If the process area to be deleted is a team area, the recursive delete operation deletes all team areas that are direct and indirect children in the team area hierarchy.

If the process area to be deleted is a team area which is a root of a team area hierarchy tag, the tag is removed from the team area and all of its children.

Parameters:
processItemHandle - the process item handle to be deleted
recursively - true if child process items should be deleted as well, false otherwise
monitor - the progress monitor or null
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails or the process item can not be deleted
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - in case this operation has been canceled
Since:
0.7

initialize

IProjectArea initialize(IProjectArea projectArea,
                        org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                        throws TeamRepositoryException,
                               TeamOperationCanceledException
Initializes the given project area. After successful initialization a project area is ready for use.

This method executes a process enabled operation with the id IProcessItemService.OP_ID_INITIALIZE_PROJECT_AREA.

Note that each project area may only be initialized once.

Parameters:
projectArea - the project area
monitor - a progress monitor or null
Returns:
the initialized project area
Throws:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - in case this operation has been canceled
TeamOperationCanceledException - in case this operation has been cancelled by process
TeamRepositoryException - in case this operation fails

archiveProcessItem

void archiveProcessItem(IProcessItem processItem,
                        org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                        throws TeamRepositoryException
Archives the given process item and all items below it. After being archived, no new references to an area should be established.

Parameters:
processItem - the process item
monitor - a progress monitor or null
Throws:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - in case this operation has been canceled
TeamRepositoryException - in case this operation fails

findTeamAreaHierarchies

java.util.List findTeamAreaHierarchies(IContributor user,
                                       IProcessAreaHandle parentHandle,
                                       java.util.Collection properties,
                                       org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                       throws TeamRepositoryException
Returns the collection of team areas rooted at the given process area in which the given user is a member.

The returned areas are managed by the item manager.

Parameters:
user - the contributor that is a member of a team in the hierarchy
parentHandle - the process area
properties - the list of required team area properties; use IProcessClientService.ALL_PROPERTIES to retrieve complete items
monitor - a progress monitor or null
Returns:
the collection of team areas that form the hierarchy where the user is a member
Throws:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - in case this operation has been canceled
TeamRepositoryException - in case this operation fails

                             IProjectAreaHandle projectAreaHandle,

fetchCompleteIterationStructure

java.util.List fetchCompleteIterationStructure(IProjectAreaHandle projectAreaHandle,
                                               org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                               throws TeamRepositoryException
Fetches the complete iteration structure of the given project area. Returns an unsorted list containing the project area, its iteration types, its development lines and its iterations. All returned development lines and iterations are shared in the item manager.

The returned iterations are managed by the item manager.

Parameters:
projectAreaHandle - a handle to the project area
monitor - the progress monitor or null
Returns:
an unsorted list of all items constituting the iteration structure
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException - in case this operation fails

findAdministratorsFor

java.util.List findAdministratorsFor(IProcessAreaHandle areaHandle,
                                     org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                     throws TeamRepositoryException
Returns the collection of contributors who are designated as administrators for the given process area.

This method does not return an exhaustive list of admins. Instead, this method walks up the team area hierarchy from the given area looking for the first area with administrators assigned. Once such an area is found, these admins are returned.

The returned contributors are managed by the item manager.

Parameters:
areaHandle - the starting area
monitor - the progress monitor or null
Returns:
the set of administrators responsible for this area.
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException

deployPredefinedProcessDefinitions

IProcessDefinition[] deployPredefinedProcessDefinitions(java.lang.String[] processIds,
                                                        org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                        throws TeamRepositoryException
Requests the server to deploy or update all predefined process definitions. This method returns all the process definitions that have been deployed, if the deployment was overall successful. This method will throw a TeamRepositoryException if there was an error for any of the predefined process definitions. However, even in the cause of an exception, predefined process definitions might have been deployed.

The returned definitions are managed by the item manager.

Parameters:
processIds - the process ids of the process definitions to be deployed or null for all predefined process definitions
monitor - the progress monitor or null
Returns:
the deployed/updated process definitions
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException - in case any of the predefined definitions could not successfully be deployed

isProjectAreaUpdateable

java.lang.Boolean isProjectAreaUpdateable(IProjectArea projectArea,
                                          org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                          throws TeamRepositoryException
Determines whether the given projectArea can be updated with features defined in the latest version of the template used to create the projectArea

Parameters:
projectArea - IProjectArea, should not be null.
monitor - the progress monitor or null.
Returns:
true if the project area can be updated, false otherwise.
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException - if there is a problem communicating with the repository.

IProjectArea[] updateProjectAreas(IProjectAreaHandle[] areasToUpdate,
                                  org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                  throws TeamRepositoryException
Update the areasToUpdate with features defined in the latest version of the templates used to create them.

Parameters:
areasToUpdate - array of IProjectArea to update.
monitor - the progress monitor or null.
Returns:
the updated project areas, may be empty.
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException - if there is a problem communicating with the repository.

getUpdateableProjectAreas

IProjectArea[] getUpdateableProjectAreas(IProjectAreaHandle[] projectAreaHandles,
                                         org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                         throws TeamRepositoryException
Returns all project areas in the array of projectAreaHandle for which there is a project area updater registered.

Parameters:
projectAreaHandles - IProcessAreaHandle), should not be null.
Returns:
IProjectArea of fully populated project areas that can be updated; may be empty.
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException - if there is a problem communicating with the repository.

getAllProcessProviders

IProjectArea[] getAllProcessProviders(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                      throws TeamRepositoryException
Returns the project areas that allow others to use their process.

Parameters:
monitor - the monitor or null.
Returns:
IProjectArea array of fully populated project areas that allow other areas to use their process
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException - if there is a problem communicating with the repository.

getURIForProcessArea

java.lang.String getURIForProcessArea(IProcessArea processArea,
                                      org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                      throws TeamRepositoryException
Returns the URI by which the given process area is identified.

Note that this URI is a best-guess computed by the client. In order to retrieve a definitive URI, clients must consult the server by either calling the process REST service (https://jazz.net/wiki/bin/view/Main/DraftTeamProcessRestApi) or by calling the IProcessServerService Java API on the server.

Parameters:
processArea - the process area
monitor - the progress monitor or null
Returns:
the URI by which the given process area is identified
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException - if an exception occurs
